description:
The help for the "disk_weight_multiplier" config option says:

"Also note that this setting only affects scheduling if the 'ram' weigher is enabled."

That's a copy/paste error from the ram_weight_multiplier, it should say 'disk' weigher.
title: Help docs for disk_weight_multiplier option are wrong

comments.content:
The help for the "disk_weight_multiplier" config option says:

"Also note that this setting only affects scheduling if the 'ram' weigher is enabled."

That's a copy/paste error from the ram_weight_multiplier, it should say 'disk' weigher.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~mriedem

comments.content:
Fix proposed to branch: master
Review: https://review.openstack.org/446177
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~hudson-openstack

comments.content:
Reviewed:  https://review.openstack.org/446177
Committed: https://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/nova/commit/?id=3397c7582e3f6e1a7030e29e0d7df5ef26ed0c4f
Submitter: Jenkins
Branch:    master

commit 3397c7582e3f6e1a7030e29e0d7df5ef26ed0c4f
Author: Matt Riedemann <email address hidden>
Date:   Wed Mar 15 17:14:25 2017 -0400

    Fix the help for the disk_weight_multiplier option
    
    There was what looks to be a copy/paste error in the help
    text for the "disk_weight_multiplier" config option. It should
    say the disk weigher needs to be enabled, not the ram weigher.
    
    Change-Id: Ic6e3601e18adce2a01f36e956fbce3e366b08b80
    Closes-Bug: #1673261
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~hudson-openstack

comments.content: This issue was fixed in the openstack/nova 16.0.0.0b1 development milestone.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~hudson-openstack
